com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.jms

Class JmsAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.centurylink.mdw.services.process.BaseActivity
      • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.activity.DefaultActivityImpl
        • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.AdapterActivityBase
          • com.centurylink.mdw.workflow.adapter.jms.JmsAdapter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AdapterActivity, GeneralActivity, AdapterInvocationError

    @Tracked(value=TRACE)
public class JmsAdapter
extends AdapterActivityBase
    New implementation of JMS Adapter which can be configured through Designer and does not implement ControlledAdapterActivity interface.

    • Method Detail

      • isSynchronous

        public boolean isSynchronous()
        The synchronous JMS adapter is not yet implemented, so the method always returns false.
        Specified by:
        isSynchronous in interface AdapterActivity
        Specified by:
        isSynchronous in class AdapterActivityBase
        Returns:
        true if it needs to wait for responses

      • getQueueName

        protected java.lang.String getQueueName()
                                 throws PropertyException
        The method is used by openConnection() to obtain the queue name. The default implementation returns the value of the attribute "Queue Name", using getAttributeValueSmart, so that a variable or property specification is allowed in addition to plain queue name. You can override the method to obtain a queue name in a different way.
        Returns:
        the actual name of the remote queue to receive the message.
        Throws:
        PropertyException

      • invoke

        public java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.Object conn,
                               java.lang.Object requestData)
                        throws AdapterException,
                               ConnectionException
        The method overrides the one in the super class to perform JMS specific functions.
        Specified by:
        invoke in class AdapterActivityBase
        Returns:
        response if the adapter is synchronous, or the underlying protocol is synchronous. Return null if the adapter is asynchronous and the underlying protocol is asynchronous
        Throws:
        AdapterException - Adapter exception may or may not be retriable, which you can set in the exception itself. Default is not retriable.
        ConnectionException - certain protocol may also throw ConnectionException here. ConnectionException can be retried.

      • getCorrelationId

        protected java.lang.String getCorrelationId()
                                     throws PropertyException
        Throws:
        PropertyException

      • getTimeoutForResponse

        protected int getTimeoutForResponse()
        Timeout value for waiting for responses. Used for synchronous mode only. The default method reads from the attribute "Time out (sec)", and return 30 seconds if the attribute is not defined.
        Returns:
        timeout value in seconds

      • closeConnection

        protected void closeConnection(java.lang.Object connection)
        The method overrides the one in the super class to perform JMS specific functions.
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in class AdapterActivityBase

      • openConnection

        protected java.lang.Object openConnection()
                                   throws ConnectionException
        The method overrides the one in the super class to perform JMS specific functions.
        Specified by:
        openConnection in class AdapterActivityBase
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ConnectionException - retriable connection failure

      • getRequestData

        protected java.lang.Object getRequestData()
                                   throws ActivityException
        The method overrides the one from the super class and perform the followings:
        • It gets the value of the variable with the name specified in the attribute REQUEST_VARIABLE. The value is typically an XML document or a string
        • It invokes the variable translator to convert the value into a string and then return the string value.
        The method will through exception if the variable is not bound, or the value is not bound to a DocumentReference or String.
        Overrides:
        getRequestData in class AdapterActivityBase
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ActivityException - when the attribute cannot be fetched for any reason
